document.docAuthor: Dijkstra, Klaas-Douwe B., Kipping, Jens & Mézière, Nicolas
document.docTitle: Pseudagrion aureolum Dijkstra, Meziere & Kipping, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Sixty new dragonfly and damselfly species from Africa (Odonata)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sixty new dragonfly and damselfly species from Africa (Odonata)

heading.emphasis:
Pseudagrion aureolum Dijkstra, Mézière & Kipping
sp. nov. –

subSubSection.paragraph:
Genetically, morphologically and ecologically unlike any other species of the B-group of
Pseudagrion Selys, 1876
(see Dijkstra et al. 2007 ).

Holotype
♂
. Gabon , Haut-Ogooué Province , Batéké Plateau, road to Léconi Park, Laboumi River , sandy stream ( 4–6 m ),
445 m
a.s.l. (
1.5232 ° S
14.2906 ° E
),
30 -xii- 2008
, leg. N. Mézière , RMNH
.

caption.paragraph:
Type Photo 18 .
Holotype of
Pseudagrion aureolum
sp. nov. , RMNH (horizontally mirrored from original).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Two unique haplotypes (n = 7 ) are well-separated from but nearest to
P. glaucescens
Selys, 1876
and
P. isidromorai
Compte Sart, 1967
.
Latin “golden” refers to the rich colour of this species (neuter adjective).

caption.paragraph:
Photo 27.
Pseudagrion aureolum
, male; Batéké Plateau, Gabon. Photo: JK (21-ix- -2013)

Photo 28. The crystal clear Léconi River on the Batéké Plateau, Gabon.
Pseudagrion aureolum
is common on its grassy banks. Photo: JK (22-ix- -2013)

Figure 12. Penis in lateral and ventral view (left) and male appendages in dorsal (middle) and lateral view (right) of selection of
Pseudagrion
B-group species;
P. tanganyicum
sp. nov. is structurally identical to
P. massaicum
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Open and clear streams, rivers and lakes between 300 and 550 m a.s.l. on the sandy Batéké Plateau in south-eastern Gabon ( Photos 26 , 28 ). This is an unusual habitat for the B-group of
Pseudagrion
, which prefers warmer habitats such as sluggish rivers and ponds.
